page.title: 17LIVE STYLE IN WYDDIAL
page.content: This is an area with no real social cohesion. The outlying groups of houses are all on the edge of larger communties to which they look. Wyddial village has no shop, no school, no public house. As an ecclesiastical parish it is now part of Hormead where the vicar lives. There is usually a Sunday morning service in the church but there is no other community activity of any sort. Children are taken out of the village to school and some go to boarding school. Each week milk is delivered twice weekly from Buntingford. A general shop at Buckland deliveries groceries and frozen meat weekly and will deliver pensions. A mobile library comes fortnightly. All other shopping and any social activity must be elsewhere.
